original: Fremling, Josef Oskar, fd. rektor, Amål, f. 19/10/72 i Tengene, Skarab. L, av folksk :lär. Johan F. o. Britta Johansdotter. G. 08 m. Karin Månsson. Barn: Britta f. 10, Sven 12, Lars 15, Märta 22. — Stud:ex. 92, fil kand. 97, teor. teol. ex., prakt. teol. ex. samt prästv. 01, provår 01-02. E. o. lär. i Borås 02-05, i Örebro 05-07, ord. ’l’ärov:adj. i Amål 07, rektor där 14-38. Led. av kyrkofullm. o. kyrkoråd, huv :man i Åmåls Sparbank, över-förmynd., ordf. i pens:ndn o. v. ordf. i fam:bidr:ndn t. 46., sekr. i stadens jub:komm., led. av konventsrådet f. Kar|lstads stifts kyrkobröder, fd. led. av stadsfullm. o. dess v. ordf., led. av drätselkamm., led. av styr. f. byggn :-komm. f. lärov. o. folksk., orator v. Karlstads stifts prästmöte 35. LVO.
translated: Fremling, Josef Oskar, former principal, from Amål, born on October 19, 1872 in Tengene, Skaraborg County, son of the primary school teacher Johan F. and Britta Johansdotter. Married in 1908 to Karin Månsson, they had four children: Britta (born 1910), Sven (1912), Lars (1915), and Märta (1922). He passed his school leaving exam in 1892, obtained a BA in 1897, took theoretical and practical theology exams, and was ordained into the priesthood in 1901 after a year of internship. He was an assistant teacher in Borås from 1902 to 1905, in Örebro from 1905 to 1907, and became a regular teacher in Amål in 1907 and its principal from 1914 to 1938. He was a member of the Church Council and the Parish Council, the chairman of Åmåls Sparbank, a trustee, chairman of the pension committee, and vice chairman of the family aid committee. He was secretary of the town's jubilee committee and a member of the convent council for Karlstad Diocese's church brothers. He was a former member of the Town Council and its vice chairman, a member of the finance committee, a member of the steering committee for the construction committee for secondary and primary schools, and a speaker at Karlstad Diocese's priest meeting in 1935. He was awarded LVO.
